The claim was based on an article by Dr: Sanjay Gupta published on CNN.com, which stated that "80 percent of the world's pain pills are consumed in the United States."
The claim was independently verified by: who confirmed that the statistic originated from the American Society of Interventional Pain Physicians (ASIPP), a group with 4,500 members based in Kentucky.
The United Nations: International Narcotics Control Board's 2014 report supported the claim by stating that the United States consumes 78 percent of the world's oxycodone, 99 percent of the world's hydrocodone, and 51 percent of the world's hydromorphone.
